summary: Multi-module service booking platform with Customer app, Employee/Staff app, Admin panel, backend, IVR booking/reminder integration, and payment/subscription support.
architectural_notes: System consists of Customer app, Employee/Staff app, Admin panel, Backend, and IVR integration.
OTP-based authentication using mobile number for customers (and employee auth required).
IVR providers considered: Exotel or Twilio; IVR flow validates mobile/subscription and creates bookings.
Payment gateways considered: Razorpay or Stripe; support recurring payments for subscriptions.
Push notifications via Firebase Cloud Messaging (FCM).
Backend tech options listed: Node.js/Express or Django; database options listed: MongoDB or PostgreSQL.
Security requirements: secure payment gateway integration, data encryption and secure storage.

existing_features.title: Create a role-based web app with three modules (Customer, Employee/Staff, Admin) accessible from a single React UI, with navigation guarded by role and login state.

Implement authentication using Internet Identity and add application-level profiles that store a userâ€™s mobile number and role (customer/staff/admin). Require a verified mobile number on the profile before allowing service booking.

Provide a mobile-number OTP verification flow that works without external SMS providers by using a development-only OTP mechanism: generate an OTP in the backend and display it in the UI for verification (clearly labeled as a demo/dev mode).
Create data models and CRUD for subscription plans and service categories (plumber, electrician, electronic repair, pest control, car wash) and expose them in the Customer module for browsing.

Implement service booking: customers can book a service by selecting category, entering address details, choosing a preferred time slot, and confirming; booking requires a mobile-verified customer profile.
Implement customer booking views: upcoming bookings and service history with status timeline and details per booking.
Implement Staff module: staff users can view assigned jobs, a schedule view, job details (including customer details/history), and can update job/service status.
Implement Admin panel features for business control: manage customers, staff, services, subscriptions; allocate bookings to staff; and monitor overall booking pipeline.
Add Support & Feedback: customers can submit support tickets/feedback; staff can receive ratings/feedback linked to completed bookings; admin can review and export these records.

Implement payment tracking and reconciliation records for bookings and subscriptions (without external payment gateway dependency): record payment method (UPI/card/wallet), amount, status, and reconciliation notes; allow admin updates.

Implement IVR 'call task' queue management in the backend and admin UI: whenever a booking is created/updated, create call tasks for reminders/updates; admin can configure basic IVR settings and mark tasks as completed/failed (no external calling integration required).

Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme across the UI (colors, typography, layout) suitable for a service-booking business dashboard + consumer app; avoid blue/purple as dominant colors; ensure all user-facing strings are in English.

Add static generated brand and category imagery as frontend assets and use them in the UI (home/category tiles, admin header). Store assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend.

new_feature_requests.summary: Customer app: OTP-based mobile registration/login and account access control
Customer app: Browse subscription plans and service categories (plumber/electrician/electronics repair/pest control/car wash)
Customer app: Book services using registered mobile number; view history and upcoming bookings
Employee/Staff app: Registration/login, job assignments & scheduling, update service status, view customer details/history
Employee/Staff app: Payment tracking/reconciliation plus feedback & ratings
Admin panel: Employee/service/customer management, allocation, payment reconciliation, reporting/analytics, IVR configuration
IVR integration: Collect booking data via IVR, validate customer mobile/subscription, automated reminders/updates, sync with apps/backend
Backend: Store IVR/app data, validate subscription, allocate jobs by availability/location, status updates & notifications
Payments: UPI/cards/wallets support, recurring subscriptions, payment tracking and reconciliation

Implement a backend allocation helper that suggests staff for a booking based on availability and (simple) location matching, where location is captured as a text area/zone label in both staff profile and booking address.

Add IVR integration endpoints: accept booking creation/updates from an external IVR provider via authenticated HTTP calls to the backend, validate the provided mobile number against registered customers, and create bookings using the IVR flow fields.

Implement basic security measures: role checks on all backend methods, input validation, and at-rest storage patterns suitable for Motoko stable data; ensure sensitive fields (like OTP) are not returned except in the explicitly labeled demo OTP flow.
